channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: ‘Magic: The Gathering’ Ends the Tyrannical Scourge of This Lil’ Guy
item.description: Poor Vivi and his reign in the 'Magic' meta is over.

item.title: Lenovo goes literal with its view of the future of "the cloud" - here's what it thinks future data centers will really look like
item.description: Lenovo proposes extreme data center designs, from floating clouds to underground bunkers.

item.title: A better way of thinking about the AI bubble
item.description: AI isn't all or nothing, and even good bets can turn sour if you aren't careful about how you make them.

item.title: Rad Power Bikes faces shutdown in January without new funding
item.description: The company is "still fighting to find ways to continue" according to an email viewed by TechCrunch.

item.title: Saudi Arabia’s Dystopian Futuristic City Project Is Crashing and Burning
item.description: Who could have seen this coming?

item.title: Kaltura acquires eSelf, founded by creator of Snap’s AI, in $27M deal
item.description: Kaltura acquires AI avatar startup eSelf to integrate generative AI into enterprise video and learning tools.

item.title: An annual Walmart Plus membership is half off right now
item.description: If you have a mountain of holiday shopping to tackle over the next few weeks, Walmart is offering a great deal on Walmart Plus. New subscribers can snag an annual Walmart Plus membership for half off through December 2nd. The deal knocks the yearly price down to $49 ($49 off), which will automatically renew at […]

item.title: Après Shein, Amazon est épinglé pour la vente de poupées sexuelles enfantines en Suède
item.description: Après Shein, c'est au tour d'Amazon d'avoir un très sérieux problème de pédopornographie. L'organisation suédoise ChildX a déposé plainte contre le géant américain du commerce en ligne en raison de la présence dans ses rayons virtuels de poupées sexuelles à l'apparence d'enfants. Deux autres plateformes d'e-commerce, non citées, sont également ciblées....

item.title: The Military’s Plan for Pennywise on ‘It: Welcome to Derry’ Is Completely Unhinged
item.description: We're only three episodes in, but this isn't going to end well for anyone, is it?

item.title: Want some cheap noise-cancelling headphones that are actually good this Black Friday? Here are 3 we love based on real-world testing
item.description: They were cheap to start with, and in the Black Friday deals, these headphones will almost certainly be a double bargain

item.title: Looking to slice your cloud bill? This new service lets you rent Lenovo workstations 50% cheaper than public cloud alternatives
item.description: IMSCAD and Lenovo provide dedicated remote workstations for heavy 3D software, cutting costs and outperforming high-end public cloud services.

item.title: What if Tamagotchi-Like Toys Were Really Alive? These Researchers Just Made It Happen
item.description: SquidKid is a small bioreactor housing real, glowing bacteria for children to nurture and raise.

item.title: Is Maxton Hall the new The Summer I Turned Pretty?
item.description: "Maxton Hall" Season 2 is now the most popular show on Prime Video, overtaking fellow teen drama "The Summer I Turned Pretty."

item.title: Google says its confusing Gemini Home rollout is going just great
item.description: Google started rolling out its new Gemini voice assistant for its smart speakers two weeks ago and, in a blog post marking the anniversary, the company seems to think everything is going great. It’s even quoting a user who said, “My Google Home just got upgraded with Gemini. It’s actually useful now beyond asking for […]

item.title: The next iPhone Air has reportedly been delayed
item.description: Apple is no longer planning to launch a second-generation iPhone Air next fall and has “already sharply scaled back production of the first version,” The Information reports. The company launched the super-thin version of the iPhone in September, but it seemingly hasn’t proven to be a big hit, and Apple is now making some changes […]

item.title: The Duffer Brothers Have Known How ‘Stranger Things’ Would End for Years
item.description: 'Stranger Things' will end in the next few weeks, and it's the culmination of a vision long in the making.

item.title: All the gear and no idea – my new phone camera is wasted on me, but Google might have already found a solution
item.description: My Oppo Find X9 Pro's camera is so great it doesn’t need an upgrade when the 10 drops – I do

item.title: Did women ruin the workplace? Maybe for the boys club
item.description: A controversial ‘New York Times’ podcast about feminism sparked backlash across the internet. Recently, New York Times opinion columnist Ross Douthat moderated a debate on the Interesting Times podcast between Helen Andrews and Leah Libresco Sargeant, two conservative critics of modern feminism. The podcast received major blowback, starting with (but not ending with) the fact that the original headline of the conversation was “Did Women Ruin the Workplace?” Quickly, after the predictable backlash hit, the headline was changed to “Did Liberal Feminism Ruin the Workplace?” But the diversion didn...

item.title: Marriott and Sonder just had a messy breakup — and guests are caught in the middle
item.description: The end of Marriott’s deal with Sonder triggered canceled bookings and evictions, sparking outrage from loyal Bonvoy members. Sonder Holdings said on Monday it will wind down its operations and file for bankruptcy one day after Marriott International abruptly announced that it had terminated its licensing agreement with the San Francisco operator of thousands of rental properties....

item.title: Le flop de l’iPhone Air fera-t-il capoter le lancement de son successeur ?
item.description: Encore des mauvaises nouvelles pour l'iPhone Air. Apple aurait décidé de reporter le lancement de la deuxième génération de son smartphone ultra-fin, qui était plus ou moins attendue pour l'automne 2026.

item.title: Best Buy Black Friday Apple deals are live – record-low prices on AirPods, MacBooks, iPads and more
item.description: Black Friday Apple deals are live at Best Buy, and I'm rounding up today's top offers that I recommend buying now, including AirPods, MacBooks, and more.

item.title: Tesla’s new plan to get cars out of showrooms takes on Hertz
item.description: The EV maker, which is struggling as Biden-era tax credits have expired, is now getting into the rental car market. Tesla is getting into the rental car market.

item.title: Gemini for TV is coming to Google TV Streamer starting today
item.description: Gemini for TV is rolling out to Google TV Streamer devices starting today, allowing almost anyone to try it out. Since it launched back in September, Gemini for TV has only been available on a limited number of smart TVs. If you didn’t have one of those devices, you were out of luck. Gemini for […]

item.title: Médias sociaux | TikTok se lance à son tour dans les balados filmés
item.description: TikTok a annoncé lundi un accord avec le géant de la radio iHeartMedia pour créer des balados filmés d’influenceurs dont des extraits seront diffusés sur le réseau social, une nouvelle illustration de l’appétit des plateformes vidéo pour ce média.
